meanings.definition: To dig up (a body) that has been buried.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists carefully misinterred the ancient remains for further study.
meanings.sent2: The cemetery workers misinterred the coffin to move it to a different location.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the characters accidentally misinterred a treasure chest instead of a time capsule.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to misinter the memories buried deep in the old tree's roots.
meanings.sent5: The detective's job was to misinter the truth hidden beneath layers of lies.

meanings.definition: To mistakenly unearth or exhume (something buried).
meanings.sent1: The curious dog misinterred a bone buried in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers misinterred an old artifact while digging the foundation.
meanings.sent3: The kids playing in the park accidentally misinterred a buried time capsule from a school project.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to misinter the buried emotions, bringing them back to the surface.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected discovery misinterred a long-forgotten secret of the town's history.
